Reviews.Title: “website is TOTALLY misleading!”
Reviews.Author: P B
Reviews.Content: Plain and simple: WHAT A DUMP! It's one of those hotels on a sketchy side street, with the front desk behind a glass barrier. The rooms smell, are very tiny, and need renovations. Not to mention walking down these hallways thru the laundry room, past some pathetic TV lounge etc. The only positive aspect is the location, but other than that?.... DON'T BOTHER!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel? No. This is not a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TAS84
Reviews.Content: A hotel is a somewhere you go to feel comfortable during the overnight hours of your vacation/business trip or get away. In this case, Montreal for the weekend with my significant other. "Hotel" Dorion, is not a hotel. The only way in which it resembles a hotel is there are rooms with 4 walls made up of physical matter and filled with oxygen. (Oxygen with a, lets say, unique, smell to it.) There are 1000 reasons to not stay here, I'll present them in logical order. Upon arriving, you'll quickly learn there is NO parking area. You have to park on the street surrounding the hotel. Not an uncommon thing in Montreal, although in this case, you get to feel a bit uneasy about the young men standing on the corner of Rue Dorion running his " business" watching you unload your suitcases from your vehicles at 10:00pm, hoping that your vehicle will still be there in the morning. When you make your way to the entrance, you will then get to "buzz in" to gain access to the "hotel", nothing makes you feel more welcomed as a guest then having to buzz into your hotel. If you're granted access, you walk up the staircase which is basically an apartment building up to the 2nd level where "reception" is. Get use to my quoting of words, as what you traditionally expect from a hotel, you won't find here. So when you get upstairs to check in, the front desk worker basically verified we had an reservation, confirmed we had prepaid for it, ( which if it hadn't been, we'd have turned around a left before even seeing our "One bedroom suite". ) So he hands us a key, says your room is this way, and off we go. Strolling through this apartment building style "hotel" wondering what we've gotten ourselves into. We arrive at our door, look at each other, and just stake our heads, as we know what to expect just from our first impression of Hotel Dorion. (3 minutes since we got out of our car) So we open the door to find,.. why don't I just summarize to save you some time before you begin looking for another hotel as you sit at your computer. (I beg of you) - The smell hits you in the face. - Room is tiny, bed in the middle of the room, night stand. Old beat up TV. Lamp. Nothing more. - Bathroom off that room, door is one more opening away from falling off the hinges. - No soap in the bathroom. - Towels, while folded ( bravo ) look 15 years old. - The toilet itself, lets just say its a squatting situation. - The carpet in the room is filthy. kept our shoes on. - The Bed sheets. Yeah, we didn't find out. One look at the bed and I was infinitely thankful my significant other packed a sheet. We laid it over the entire bed, and slept on that, arms at our sides because it still felt so dirty. The bedspread was stained, again, 15+ years old. - Old, old, stinky, dirty, old, old. Yuck. That's basically how it can be summed up. We are a younger couple, we don't have extremely high expectations of hotels, as we don't travel much. A holiday inn, best western, totally fine hotels. $100-$140 dollar a night range is totally fine with us. ( This was $85 ) However, there are SIMPLE. BASIC. Things anyone would expect from a hotel that this place simple CANNOT provide. Comfort, BASIC amenities, cleanliness. Dorion has none of it. We had unfortunately booked for SEVERAL days, a couple hundred bucks we gladly flushed down the crapper that is Hotel Dorion after the first night. Our flight was in late that evening, and really just needed to crash. ALSO: Please, please, please know. That the positive reviews on trip advisor are CLEARLY phony. Most definitely created by an employee/owner to create a rouse so people will give Dorion a chance. People have said they'll only stay here when traveling to Montreal, clean rooms, friendly staff ( they weren't unfriendly, but the whole business lacks any customer service. ) All of it is complete crap. I mean this with no disrespect, but if I were homeless, I would SERIOUSLY consider the street over this establishment. A few things in closing. You can read some reviews here about the hotel being above a strip club. Fact. Also it is used regularly for prostitution. While we saw a few " candidates" who were checking in right behind us, likely for the "hourly" rate that is clearly advertised right at the front desk, I can't confirm this, but it's a safe bet. We obviously did our best to basically lock ourselves in our room to avoid seeing anything else that would make us cringe. We eventually went batshit crazy in our room laughing about the whole situation, and decided there and then that we'd be writing this in hopes of saving other unsuspecting people their money, and time. In closing, we rolled the dice and used a third party site to book this hotel (expedia, hot wire , etc ) SHAME ON THEM for advertising/partnering with an establishment like this. For real? I understand there are such things as 1 and 1/2, and 2 star hotels, but that's not what this is, it's a dump. That third party site lost our business for all future travels, and I planned on contacting them formally as well. Sincerely, SFD (still fells dirty)

Reviews.Title: “Fun and out of the way”
Reviews.Author: pmartelToronto
Reviews.Content: How does one describe Hotel Dorion?? This was my FIRST trip to Quebec and Montreal, being on a super toght budget, I was looking around for a hoetl which would fill the bill. Hotel Dorion caught my eye. Hotel Dorion is right in the heart of Montreal's Gay Village. Having this been my first trip to Montreal I had no clue as to what to expect, let alone using my rusty French I took way back in 1974. The staff at Dorion are wondeful,and the manager of the hotel was incredibly helpful at setting things up for me. Dorion is easy to get to by the Metro (Subway) once you get your bearings coming in from the Montreal train station, get off at Papineau stn, BUT look for Rue Dorion on the left side of the subway exit and you will see a Metro grocery store. The rooms are clean mostly quiet and very no frills especially on the 2nd floor as it is an older part of the hotel. If anyone is one a budget and looking for an affordable place in the heart of Montreal, this is a little gem. I would STRONGLY advise knowing some basics in French is a BIG HELP and will go far

Reviews.Title: “To be repeated”
Reviews.Author: HansNiemeijer
Reviews.Content: It was really a guess to choose from the many hotels especially when you have never been in MontrÃ©al. But o la la, what a friendly hotel and a good bunch of people working there. They even help you with your French. Always coffee available, rooms are okay. Very pleasant shower. In the common room you can eat your own food; fridge, toaster and microwave can be used . If you want your clothes will be washed for just $ 6 (â‚¬ 4,50). If you don't need a fancy hotel this is the one for you! Leave the hotel and there is a nice square with trees from where you can get buses and the metro. When we left the manager told us that she would going to miss us. Who doesn't want to come back to an hotel like that?

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the Gay Village”
Reviews.Author: Eddieisready
Reviews.Content: During my annual trips to Montreal, I always stay at the Hotel Dorion, which is located in the Gay Village near the Metro. I enjoy the friendly staff that always treats their customers with the utmost courtesy. The manager, Joanne, in particular, goes out-of-her-way to make sure that my stay at the hotel is a pleasurable experience. The staff is very helpful in providing information about things to do in Montreal, including restaurants, directions and tourist attractions. The room is always clean with fresh linen and towels, and a pot of coffee is always brewing. I would recommend the Hotel Dorion to anyone looking for an economical, friendly and convenient place to stay in the Gay Village.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience.........”
Reviews.Author: heavymtlvisitor
Reviews.Content: Well, when we (myself, my girlfriend, and our 2 friends) arrived at the hotel we were surprised by an empty needle casing and used condom laying on the street by my car. Yes, you park on the street because there is no parking lot. We noticed right away the hotel was not very pleasant to look at, and it didnt get much better when we went inside. Although the people working there were very nice, the hotel lacked some things we find important when staying somewhere for the night. The most lacking would be cleanliness, the floors were not vacuumed and the roomm had a slight odor to it. The bedding was not very nice, and we decided to just sleep on top of the blankets in fear of what was waiting beneath the blanket. Bars on the windows for safety would be nice to protect us from the friendly gentleman who was high on pills and crack. All in all we had a nice trip to montreal, the people were very friendly and the hotel staff was very nice, but next time we will stay in a better part of the town.

Reviews.Title: “very clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: funman87
Reviews.Content: When i arrived at the Hotel i didnâ€™t really know what to expect.My room was clean and comfortable. My bed was very comfortable and I slept very well.The staff were great and very helpful.I had a grat time in dorion i recommend.

Reviews.Title: “once, and never again!”
Reviews.Author: sloppyjoe009
Reviews.Content: this place is by far the most ranchiest place i have ever been in, i choose this place based on its location! the website is well done, it looks proper and pricing is not all that bad!. i reserved the room 1 day in advance and was asked to call before noon the next day if there were any cancelations. (i didnt call cause there wasnt ) when i arrived, the manager said i was supose to call because she wanted to make sure the room was proper and the "sheets didnt have any holes in it" because those are for the locals....which i then thought its for escort services....i didnt want that in my head. people were coming in and out, the clients that rented the rooms by the hour. older men with either women or younger men!. room doors being opened and closed throughout the night. at one point of the night, i caught the receptionist (male, mid 40s) come out of a dark room with a younger man, because i rang the front bell for assistance. he then interrogated me, asking me who i was and what room i was in. he verified all my information even tho i told him i had a key!. i felt degraded and assumed he thought i was one of the locals coming in off the street. in the room i was in, it wasnt all that bad, the floors were dirty, but not visibly, i was wearing white socks and they werent white no more. the bathroom door was ready to fall off and the bath tube was full of cigarette burns on the edges. the shower curtain was torn to nothing and was being held up by a few holes that were left intact. the location of the hotel is directly above a strip bar. the clients that are outside are much older men (50-60) with very young men acting like a complete sl^&*t. i would never in my life time, recommend this place to anyone. UNLESS you are looking to rent from this place by the hour and make some quick cash!...;)

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT STAY AT THE DORION”
Reviews.Author: drgleason
Reviews.Content: I went to Montreal for the New Years Celebration and i had another great stay at the Dorion! ( Nothing to say the fun i had while in Montreal. ) My room was clean and comfortable. My bed was very comfortable and I slept very well. The staff (all 3 shifts) are really great people and try to assist you with any needs you may have. Very friendly! The manager who was there daily was very nice and concerning that everything was ok! Thank you! The Dorion is just in the right place for walking to everything from hitting the clubs or going out to eat. I don't expect too much when i travel, just clean and reasonable and that's what i got at the Dorion. I would suggest any traveler try the Dorion, it's the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: travelling_couple2
Reviews.Content: During my stay my room , which was cosy, was cleaned everyday, unless I asked them not to. We were offered a free continental breakfast on the weekend and the staff was very warm and made sure we were comfortable. The location was fantastic, we were walking distance for shopping and transportation was never hard to find when we needed it. Although it was a 2 star hotel, our service was better than a 4 star hotel. We had free internet and a mini fridge in our room. The 5 star hotels I have stayed in before alwalys have a fee for access of both these items. I would definately recommend this hotel for anyone staying in downtown Montreal!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent price, friendly staff, European 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: diduqueef
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research and waited until the last minute to book something because I wanted to see if I could get a good last minute deal. I could have stayed at other locations for cheaper but decided to stay at the Hotel Dorion because of the review before this one. The Good: The staff was extremely friendly. My other only experience with lodging in Montreal was at a B&B and the owner was not as friendly as the staff at the Dorion. Also, the location was literally across the street from the Metro and there was almost no noise coming from the strip club under the hotel (even though my window was directly above the club). The Bad: The room we stayed in needed serious work, the sheets had cigarette burn holes in them and the bathroom room was boarded up. We did not ask to be moved to a different room because we knew the hotel was probably full of similar type rooms. Also, despite the fact that there were no smoking signs all around the hotel, two staff members smoked while they were working inside the hotel. This hotel is a European-type 2 Star hotel (you have to have traveled in Europe to know what I'm talking about). I gave the hotel a 3 star only because the staff was friendlier than most 2 star hotel staff but really the hotel is 2-star quality.

Reviews.Title: “The Gay Village's best place to stay for its convenience, service and price.”
Reviews.Author: Wowvoyager
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in the Hotel Dorion during all of my stays in Montreal for the last 15 years due to its convenient location in the Gay Village and because of its reasonable prices. During my recent stay at the Hotel Dorion, I was pleasantly surprised by all of the improvements in the hotel since my last visit two years ago. A new wing has been added which is nicer than the old section with its attractive, clean, modern rooms and with air conditioning. My room also had a refrigerator and a fabulous Jacuzzi. Other improvements are that the hotel now offers a continental breakfast on weekends, fresh coffee is available 24 hours a day and the hotel now has wireless Internet service. The most noticeable improvement is the competent new management of the hotel, especially Joanne, who is a delight to be around and who is completely on top of the situation. Raymond and Carlos were also very helpful to us and very friendly. The bilingual staff provided good service and a friendly atmosphere at the Hotel Dorion. Everyone that I encountered was very accommodating, such as helping me with driving directions or making sure that I have fresh towels and everything that I need in my room. I like the fact that the staff, obviously, cares about their guests. With the new improvements at the Hotel Dorion, I wouldnâ€™t consider staying anywhere else in Montreal. For convenience and service at a reasonable price, it is the best place to stay in the Gay Village. I would definitely recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “affordable hotel in montreal's gay village”
Reviews.Author: whcc90069
Reviews.Content: even though this hotel is located directly above club taboo (gay strip club), it is very quiet. plus the staff members are very nice and the rooms are clean.. a metro (subway) station is located very close by as well as banks, grocery store, and of course gay clubs. old montreal and chinatown are within walking distance. my only reservation about this hotel are the staircases......they are fairly steep so you'll get plenty of exercise even while walking up to the front desk area. be sure to ask for a non-smoking room if you don't smoke. the hotel dorion is a good place to stay regardless of what your budget is.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Dorion Friendly, Clean, Great Location..”
Reviews.Author: bigsexy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Dorion from Christmas through the New Year 2006 and I believe it was a good value the price.. The 24/7 staff was very friendly, it has a secure entrance that you have to buzz to gain entrance..It is within walking distance of the Gay Village..The linens were clean, there is no room service, but they will exchange towels, sheets, etc. if you bring them to the front desk..They have a continental breakfast on weekends which is ok because there are some great restaurants nearby..The Metro Papeniau is across the street, a supermarket on the corner, a Drugstore on another corner, The Taboo [----] club and bar downstairs..The showers can however be kinda tricky with the hot water adjustments..I am returning this winter and I will be staying in the new addition..The rooms are suppose to be larger and quiter..We'll see..

Reviews.Title: “Great low budget hotel in the gay village”
Reviews.Author: Cheebs
Reviews.Content: Located in Montreal's gay village, and above a male dancer bar, this hotel is popular with gay men. Whilst the music from the bar downstairs was not loud, this isn't a quiet hotel - 'though you can certainly get a good night's sleep okay. The gay village is buzzing with bars, clubs and restaurants so this is an ideal location for anyone on a budget like I was ($60 Canadian) wanting to be able to walk back after 3am. The room was adequate. Clean room and linen, comfortable bed and enough space. Color TV with cable channels, air conditioning, telephone in the room. The ensuite bathroom was very small with a shower but, again, adequate. You enter the hotel by a buzzer at the front door, reception is on the second floor. Video cameras monitor all coridoors which are clean and well lit. Breakfast is only available at weekends, but there is a fab. cafe just across the road. Subway is just one short block from the hotel. Nearest bar is ten yards from the hotel. Hotel address: Hotel Dorion, 1477 Dorion, Montreal H2K 4A4. Tel. ------------ or toll-free ------------
